intro: Dalbergaria asteroloma, commonly known as the yellow dalbergia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its delicate, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with trifoliate leaves and small, pod-like fruits. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely used for commercial purposes.
